review: The food was perfectly fine - however, they dont have full nutritional info -- just calorie totals.  The happy hour deals seem awesome.... so why the low stars?  GET RID OF THE DAMN GNATS/FLYS ALL OVER - ITS DISGUSTING.
I didnt get food poisoning this time, I was glad.  Wasn't expecting much when we came here.   I think the freezer section in your local grocery store would be much better!

If you're hungry for dinner and are stuck in Pleasanton...do not eat here! I went out to eat with my sisters here and we all ended up getting super sick. The food is super greasy, super unhealthy and we're not going back!

If you want microwaved food at a restaurant this is the place to go. The service was horrible and the food was also. Save your money and just make your food at home it will probably turn out better and will actually be warm.

Bar & Grill Chains fight for your soul. Friday's, A-Bees, the big Pepper's, and others of their ilk are locked in an eternal battle over your patronage.  They all have nice, glossy menus with food that can't look or taste that good.  Pushing flavor and timely specials they lure you in before your eyes notice the brighter lights down the street.  If the food isn't exciting enough, the wood grain benches and plasma televisions with your manly sports game will help keep you in the seats with an extra order of beer. In the 90's, TGIF was a treat to visit.  The novelty wall decor was then novel.  Not quite a burger place, nor a steak place, not quite a sports bar, it was something anyone could relate too.  You could have a beer, mixed drink, deep fried appetizer, anything that was double the price of fast food but with service.  Today, TGIF relies on the Jack Daniel's brand to conjure an illusion of exclusivity in otherwise staple of menu items.   It had been years since I had visited a Friday's, not once since we had moved to CA.  It was lunchtime and we were in the mood to try something new. The parking lot can be a pain to make it to if you didn't know better by pulling into Rosewood and snaking your way though the strip mall.  The interior was clean and quiet.  We were one of very few customers in the early day.  There are many items to choose, but mostly grouped in how you want your burger or chicken cooked.  What toppings, what sauce?  I went ahead for the Jack Daniel's burger at nearly 1100 calories!  The sauce appears to be a mix of high fructose corn syrup and brown sugar.     Pros: Menus come with calories.  Notice how much extra energy are in meals with come in specialty sauces like Jack Daniel's. Burger was tasty.  I chose to eat half, save rest for later. Fries: I know they probably come poured out from a freezer bag, but I liked the taste. Offering clam chowder before noon. Cons: My wife was ill after eating the chowder.  We're not sure how much real clams were in there to begin with. Soft drinks are too expensive at $2.99.  That is at the far end of the curve for most all restaurants and pushes the tab too high for customers to return quickly. The service was decent, my food was good while my wife's experience will delay a return and without the chowder.  I still rank this above A-Bees and may return to the place with the giant red pepper in front to update my original review.

Am I in a restaurant or am I in a bar who thinks it's a restaurant? Came in, late night, it was "Hawaiian Night" and there was a DJ. The music was lame, the patrons around the bar were rejects from the clubs around the area, and the service made me cringe. Mind you, sat in the main dinning area and wasn't out for clubbing. "Hawaiian Night" makes you think of happy waiters/waitresses dressed to impressed. Our waitress should have just worn a Hawaiian t-shirt for her sake and ours. The food was mundane. Waitress forgot our request of salsa when we first put our order in for the kid with us. The drinks, I've had better... The music was terrible and the DJ - someone from craigslist? Friday night, pick a better location - unfortunately I couldn't as I'm not from the area. Best part of the restaurant was the hostess, quite kind and gave a keychain to the 4-yo daughter who accompanied her mother. Word of advice, you want service; you damn right ask for it right away.

We have been here more than a few times for food and happy hour, but wish the food was better.  There seemed to be a lot of flies the last time I ate lunch there.  Overall a good place for happy hour. Peace

I had a bbq chicken tossed salad today and it was absolutely delicious! The one thing I noticed about their menu here is that they include the calorie count for every dish and drink. While some people may like that.. I don't! I want to choose something delicious to eat without having to feel guilty about how many calories I just shoved down my throat.. Even some of the salads had well over 1000 calories! So much for trying to eat healthy.. But aside from that the restaurant had nice servers but incredibly slow service. Oh and before I forget to mention.. right as you enter it smells like you're in a bathroom.. GROSS! Probably won't be returning here any time soon.

We used to eat at this TGI Friday's all the time.  Tonight was the LAST night we'll eat here again.  Our service was south of "good".  The place wasn't very crowded (Wednesday night), but it took forever to get our order in.  The accommodated us by letting our table be split into two bills (two families), and honored the two coupons that we had.  From there....things went downhill.  Our server told us we'd have complimentary chips/salsa with one of our coupons, and she started us off with that.  There was a hint of attitude from her when we were ordering, but not enough to raise any suspicion of what was to come.  My brother ordered his steak "medium", and I ordered mine "medium well".  Both came out "well done"...near burnt.  The other meals for our table came out satisfactory, as far as I can tell. After receiving our meals, our waitress came by once.  I would expect better attention at any restaurant.  At least walk by and ask if we needed anything....you know, like a refill on drinks.  We practically had to beg for our bill after we finished our meals.  When our bills came out, one bill was wrong.  The other family that we were with went to get their bill fixed, and complained about the (lack of) service. I've never stiffed a tip in my life (until now).  I originally left a 12% tip, which everyone thought was too generous for our service anyway, but I just can't write down zero.  As we were walking out, the staff member that was handling our bill checkout said "Bye.  See you never."  Whoops, you got caught.  I approached her and asked "Excuse, me....did you really need to say that?", followed by a "You're #$%&*^#@ rude!".  So, I walked back to our table, scratched out the tip, and don't feel bad one bit. The management needs to review the quality of their servers.

I'm always a fan of TGIF for one reason: the Jack Daniel's sauce. I'm not sure what it is, but that sauce on anything and it's tasty. I've been here a few times, and I always order some chicken dish drenched in JD sauce. This week I had the lunch bruschetta pasta with chicken. The angel hair pasta was boring, but at least it had fresh tomatoes and other extras. The chicken was overcooked and not the highest quality. I guess that's what to expect for $6.99 lunch. I had 2 cups of JD sauce to douse it in which made it much better. If you come just make sure to get a JD sauce dish.

Food is awful and the service is worse. We had a waitress with a dysfunctional volume control. She talked as if she were in an auditorium giving a performance on stage.  We went there specifically for their famous ribs. The ribs were horrible and dried out as if they were cooked and reheated multiple times. Just bad.  The waitress visited us but once to see if we were OK but really did not give a shit what we said and left quickly. She magically returned at the end with our bill and said, "Hope you come again." She is nuts if she thinks we are stupid enough to even think that.
BOO! They don't have their bbq chicken wrap anymore!!! But I still like their wings!  I don't frequent as much as I used to, just isn't the same since a lot of the bartenders are gone now!

My girl and I love this place... Jen is our favorite all-time bartender, and yes, their happy hours are excellent! Personally I love the crowd there, always friendly, talkative and fun. The bartenders are awesome and attentive. One thing I admire about this place is that because they are a bit out of the way, they are always trying new things to try and increase interest and improve business... I really appreciate places that adapt to their surroundings and this is one of them. The food is pretty decent, not epic, but hey, it's a restaurant chain! The wings are pretty darn good though, and their loaded skins are legendary. Drinks? No better place for a good cocktail at a small price! One downside, which is NOT their fault, but the anal retentive Pleasanton Police Dept seem to stalk that parking lot all night... so be careful if you have a few drinks and are driving home.

OK place to meet for a drink in the bar, but the restaurant just has no life or energy to it.  Nothing has changed in TGI Fridays since it's inception and I just can't shake the feeling that I am eating in an airport waiting for my flight...that's the vibe.  There is hardly ever a crowd here, which is great if you want to slip in and out, but if you want some life and energy to your night out, look elsewhere.  Food is about the same as the menu itself, looks great as a glossy photo, tastes like cardboard.

Sometimes it's hard to review a super chain, but this last visit to Friday's made me think about those tasty fried green beans everyday since... Pros: -Happy Hour specials!  Half off appetizers!  This must be a terrible reflection on the economy, but excellent for my wallet! -Good server.  Can't remember her name -Not crowded at all for a Sunday afternoon Cons: -Nothing memorable about their food (except for the green beans of course!) -Fridays is consistently just okay Bottom line:  I had a buy one get one free coupon and that's why I came.  I'm a sucker for deals.  I'd go here again for more deals.

OK, I know better.  But it was late, and there wasn't anything else open and I thought it might be ok.  NOT!  Nobody to seat us, but we were told we coulnd't seat ourselves so we waited 15 minutes for someone to show up to seat our large party of 2.  It was a further 45 minutes before we could hunt down a waitress...a waitress who wasn't engaged in a fascinating discussion with patrons about the last time she got REALLY drunk...order something hopefully edible, and see some actual food.  I asked for some alterations to my order to cut down on the calories (what is it with this place smothering everything in Jack Daniels sauce??) and three separate people needed to come to our table to confirm my request.  Seriously, no sauce.  Well, I got the sauce, plus extra sauce on the side.  The last straw was the ladies bathroom...no tp.  I hunted down a server to let him know and was told, quote "well, we're not open that much longer so it'll be fine".  They weren't busy...maybe 8 people in the place.  Never again :(

Normally, I LOVE TGI Fridays. There used to be 2 in the Sacramento area. My family would go to Fridays about once a month or two. I was really anticipating going there, since I hadn't had a Jack Daniel's Flat Iron Steak in a LONG time. We were seated relatively quickly (which I liked), but after that, things seemed to go down hill. The server got our drink orders (5 sodas and a child milkshake) quickly, but didn't bring them back until 10 minutes later.  Along with the fact that they didn't take our plates, plus the time it took to get the check, I don't think I'll be taking my family to that Friday's again. Like I said in the beginning, I Love Friday's, but I am severely disappointed with the service I received at this particular resteraunt.

update: 10-21`-2010-- i must give credit where credit is due. after my horrible experience there i posted here on yelp and i also sent an email to their corporate office giving them the scoop. they were kind enough to follow up, as did the manager of this location, to please try them again. i did friday night.  waiter was very pleasant (anthony?) although i still had to wait 5 mins before getting asked if i wanted anything to eat. food was good but wasn't hot. i give 4 stars cuz they tried to make up my cruddy experience and followed through, weaiter was nice, food was decent...just ok. will try again and let you know if the third time is a charm!] PS -- THE PARKING LOT IS IS VERY DARK AND KINDA CREEPY GETTING IN AND OUT -- NEED TO ADD SOME LIGHTS TGIF's FOR INCREASING  CUSTOMER'S COMFORT LEVEL.

Every day happy hour starts at 9 (and sometimes sooner). Pretty good beer selection and the happy hour prices make it a sweet deal. It is not loud at all and we are able to have pretty good talks there. The service is very good.  It is where we get together for our weekly guys' beer night.  All 10 of us gave it a unanimous vote for being our regular place. We are all family men, most of us work in high tech, you get the picture.

Their food is pretty good, it's a chain so you can't expect much. It can be pricey for chain food though. I recommend anything on their Jack Daniels menu, the sauce is amazing. I come in here with a pretty large group every other week or so and they are very accommodating for us. Their 9:00pm happy hour is perfect for us and you can't beat $2 beers.

I went there in May with my dad's Friend and her son.I love their Green been best.Others is soso for me.And the shrimp is not very fresh on that day.After that I went there three times.Because I really love their green been.

Went here for happy hour with some co-workers on "Friday" and had a great time. We got there kinda early for a "happy hour" it was 2:45 and it started at 3:00pm, so our waitress had no problem moving us to the bar.  The bartender was great and accomodating. He offered to take our drink orders and then ring them up at 3pm so they would be happy hour price! Nice! The sliders were good, but for $6 and you only get three? Not really a great  "happy hour" bargain. But, the green bean fries! Off the hook ! I love these things! $5 Margaritas and $5 long islands?! Can't beat that!

It was halloween so the waitrers were dressed up. We were starving after not eating since breakfast so we weren't being picky, which is why we pulled over at whatever was still open. My burger was decent but my hubby's steak was a poor excuse.. so small. I was halfway into my lemonade when I noticed there was a nat fly floating! Nasty.. and our waitress was unfazed as if it's a regular thing. She just offered to refill it, who knows if the cup was new, then charged me for it anyway. Dang! I'm not one to complain except here :) so we wont be back.

If I could give this place less than one star, I would.  We are having lunch here today.  We arrived at 11:45 and I only see one other table with customers.  That should have been my first warning.  Being a Sunday, I expect this place to fill up soon for lunch.  My first impression of the atmosphere is that they are trying to hide something because they have the lights dimmed very low.  It smells of a stale college bar where people smoke.  My food has now arrive.  I ordered the bruschetta chicken pasta, which I have ordered many, many times before.  This time it looks nothing like the dishes I have ordered before.  First, it is floating in brown liquid.  It is supposed to look fresh with fresh tomatoes on it and then be drizzles with balsamic glaze.  I think they may have just mixed balsamic glaze with marinara sauce on this one.  The noodles are way over cooked.  It really does not even look appetizing.  It does not taste like the same bruschetta pasta that I have had before many times at TGI Fridays either.    In addition to the horrible food I hear banter of waitresses talking about what they did last night and the fact that they are hungover today.  I also heard the word BULLSHIT said quite loudly by one of the waitresses.  Now I am wondering if they were talking about my meal because that is what it was.  I will never come back here.  I am very surprised that this place is even in business anymore.
Cindy our sever was friendly and the food was decent.    Thanks for the refills.   Lunch special $6.99 for a burger & fries not a bad deal.    The fruit tasted kinda Nasty but all else was good.

This is the ultimate franchise restaurant.  The food was ok, nothing special.  The server was not very attentive.  I only enjoyed my time because of the person I was with.  I probably won't come back to this place.

Only two places have gotten me brutally, painfully, disgustingly sick, and one was the TGI Friday's in the Cancun airport.   I should have known better.  My flight was cancelled, I was given a coupon.  I actually would have paid good money not to shit my pants for 36 hours.

I had the BBQ pork ravioli bites and roasted red pepper sausage and chicken penne Pros: The ravioli bites were tasty but cost more than my entree.  The pasta was only 5.99 and the perfect size.  There was a generous amount of chicken in the pasta.  The service was excellent Cons: Either the ravioli bites or the pasta left me feeling phlegmy - a sign of too much grease! I've never been a fan of this place.  I always found it dirty and was never impressed with the food.  However, I rather enjoyed the food this past visit.  While I would not choose to dine here, I will not avoid it like before
this place is horrible! super expensive prices and bad service for microwaved frozen food!
Eh. it's ok.. typical TGIF.. standard fare.  It won't dissapoint for drinks and dependable food.

I realize that it's a chain but seriously the quality of food has deteriorated.  Years back I went to Fridays once in a while and it was reasonably decent.  The turkey burger and chicken sandwich were very low quality.  Just cheap meat and small servings on the sides.  The service was pretty decent so no real problems there, which was nice.  However, the food was just bad.

Hubby and I went here for dinner yesterday and were supremely disappointed. Kimbera provided crappy service (virtually ignored us as she bent over backwards for the two large African American patrons that were scarfing down ribs and chicken and requesting refills on drinks, napkins, and to-go boxes). We ordered the All-American Chicken Sandwich and the Southwest Mac & Cheese. First of all, let me say that although prices have gone down a little, portions have gone down a helluva lot. I'm assuming this is an effort to cut costs while attempting to convince consumers that they are serving "portions sized just right" in order to "help" us all eat "healthier." What a crock. They no longer have ketchup bottles on the table, so if you want ketchup, you get a little ramekin of it. The mac & cheese was mildly warm and the cheese looked, tasted, and felt like it had been sitting under a warming lamp for too long. Did I mention the portions were small? The sandwich was okay, nothing special. And sometime during our meal, Kimber and another waitress were wiping down the walls. No, it's not because some kid threw food all over them. It looked like a regular part of the job description: "Wipe walls and musty hanging table lamps." Um, could this be done when customers aren't trying to eat? It wasn't near closing; it was around 8:00. And if she's going to wipe the walls (which you can be sure I'm not touching anyway), could she possibly wipe the sticky dessert menu as well?  I might still come here for lunch once in a while, but definitely not dinner (no matter how good those fried mac & cheese bites and fried green beans are). With lunch, you can usually make it in and out of here in no more than an hour.

Worst service...ever! We decided to got to Tgi Friday's for lunch on a weekend because of lack of options and extreme hunger. We ordered mozzarella sticks and garlic bread to start with and then ordered Cajun chicken pasta to split. The mozzarella sticks were fine...can't go wrong with deep fried cheese. The garlic bread was kinda cold.  Our waitress disappeared after getting us our drinks and apps. We had no appetizer plates, no napkins, nothing but our fingers and a big plate of fried cheese. Whatever...we'll wait. She never came around. In fact, she was serving tables around us and would actually look the other way when passing by our table! I'm not sure if she was just lazy, had too many tables to take care of, or maybe just hated the way we looked, but either way, this sucked. Someone else was finally flagged down and brought us silverware wrapped in a little piece of paper, then quickly walked away. After we were done with the starters, someone else cleared away our dishes. Yet another lady (maybe the manager?) brought our pasta (which we were splitting), and placed the plate right in the middle of our table and walked off. At this point, the service was so crappy, we couldn't help but laugh. We're being punk'd, right? Uh uh. It gets worse. We ask for dishes, and get appetizer plates. Seriously. And still no waitress to be found. Our drinks were drunk and no refills happened. We ate silently off of our tiny plates, sucking on ice chips until the waitress finally shows up, drops of the check at the table and says, "I'll take care of this whenever you're ready." Wtf?  The food sucked, the service was HORRIBLE and rude. Crappy, crappy, crappy!

My family and I went to TGI Fridays in Pleasanton on Sunday night to eat. I hadn't eaten there in a few years and we decided to give a try. Not to mention we had a $5 dollar coupon I had gotten in the mail.  Now I know why they need coupons to bring people in. The food is awful, and the portions small. The Jack Daniels pork chop (or whatever the F! they call it) the waiter recommended was dry, my 6 year old son's burger looked rare even though I asked for it medium well, and my wife's macaroni with cheese which was not suppose to have any meat in it because my wife is a vegetarian which we mentioned to the waiter had bacon bits on top which she accidentally ate because of the poor lighting in there. They just said so sorry and charged us for her meal anyway. WTF, you just gave bacon bits to a vegetarian. Maybe next time they will put crushed peanuts on someone's pasta  who mentions that they have peanut allergies and still charge them while they get rushed to the emergency room. Don't believe the hype on T. V. don't eat there.

i love this place!! I always order to go. the one thing i must warn you about is you should always call in to go orders because it can sometimes take a bit to order when you get there, depending on the time of day. also, double check if you have your sides of sauce because the cooks always seem to be forgetting to put them with the rest of your food.  my fav. items are the mozzarella sticks, boneless buffalo sticks (sauce on the side!), the sausage and penne pasta, and the mashed potatoes.  this place is the best!

i agree with everyone else who wanted to do negative stars.  but the waitress was nice and accommodating, even though the hostess was your typical teenage-girl-with-first-job-chip-on-shoulder type.  this was my first time at a tgi fridays in years, and my last. so bf and i went here only because the wait at cheesecake factory was 45 minutes and we were hungry.  first of all i'm a vegetarian.  i KNOW this means that eating at most chain restaurants will mean a limited selection for me.  i go in knowing this so that isn't a problem.  however, just because i don't eat meat, doesn't mean i don't want to be able to go out to eat with my meat eating friends without feeling like some kind of culinary leper!  i used to be able to order some kind of jack daniels pasta with portabello instead of chicken or beef.  i didn't see any possibility of that this time around. so i ordered the Mac and Cheese sans chicken (why the fuq does mac and cheese need chicken anyway?? want to add something? how about broccoli??)  my bf ordered steak (not sure which one... filet mignon? i dunno.. the tiny one!) and asked for it medium-rare (pink, not bloody).  first my plate came out with strips of chicken across it... luckily the waitress caught it before the homecoming-queen-hostess set it down and took it back for me.  when it came back, i found out it had bacon in it.  my bad for not noticing that when i ordered... their bad for destroying what otherwise sounded like a tasty mac & cheese recipe.  i spent most my time picking out pieces of bacon.  at least use bacos! they're vegan! dispite the meat, the pasta dish wasn't worth eating anyway.  bland, bland, bland, and you wouldn't taste any cheese past the crunchy stuff on top. the steak... bloody. my bf couldn't bring himself to finish it.  and even the parts he did eat, he said weren't very good or worth the time it took to eat them. should've waited the 45 min at cheesecake factory :\

I have to give it 2 stars only! The food was served could and gross! There were fruit flies flying over our heads and we were inside! I almost threw up in this place. After 2 bites I was through. Maybe I came at a bad time, yuck, thinking about makes me a little ill.  On the a good note the waitress was really nice and helpful, she provided good service, service that I would expect for a nicer establishment,

DISAPPOINTING :-(  My husband ordered ribs and they were DRY!!!  I ordered pot stickers......they were also dry and expensive!  I could've just stayed home and steamed pot stickers from Trader Joe's (the best!).  Plus - the wait was LOOOOOONG!  Server was SLOOOOOOOW!!!

Worst waitress ever!  I don't remember her name, but she was the biggest ditz ever!  I went there for lunch with my girl friend & her friend because my girl friend wanted French Onion soup.  My gf's friend ordered a shake, which took a bit longer than it should have to get to us, plus it was mostly melted by the time it did get to her.  We ordered some appetizers & our meals @ the same time.  The appetizers came out timely, but then the food came...wait...what about the soup? Ditz:  Is that it for you guys? Me:  Actually no, two things, the soup, we both ordered soup & the ribs said they came with additional BBQ sauce on the side. Ditz:  Oh, did you still want it? Me:  Well, that was the reason we came here was the soup & yes I would like the sauce. Ditz:  Oh ok, it won't be long for the soup. She comes back very timely with the soup, & told us she was sorry, that they would comp us the soup.  So plus 1 there to try & make it right.  She took back off before I could inquire about the BBQ sauce & the fact that my gf's rib portion was significantly smaller than mine.  I finally flagged her down & asked.  She took off for the sauce, but offered no explanation or anything else about the rib portion.  She comes back with the BBQ sauce as we are finishing up our ribs & drops the check off.  I give her my card & she returns to tell us to have a good day.  I asked if we could have some of the towlets for our hands & she took off for those...I assumed.  I saw her coming back our way, we make eye contact & she stops in her tracks, does an about face, heads into the kitchen & emerges seconds later with the towlets.  I guess I had assumed she would bring 3, since there were 3 of us.  There were only 2!  I guess you can't win 'em all! I give it 2 stars since the food WAS good

This is what you get when you're so hungry that your stomach acid has begun to strip away your brain's ability to make an informed decision about what goes in yo' bellay-- ahh Fridays. One of the many chain establishments where you can get a cocktail that looks and tastes like a grown-up icee with a tutu, and it's guaranteed that you'll need at least eight before you feel the buzz. Said partner and I ordered a "white sangria" that claimed to have a variety of fresh fruit juices and white wine...I mean it was that or the strawberry shortcake- looking thing with whipped cream. After twenty minutes, my heavenly beverage arrived tasting like what you'd get if you mixed watery Kool-Aid, two teaspoons of Carlo Rossi, a few spoiled grapes, and the subtle flavor of ass. My $11 or so Chicken salad came with mandarin oranges that were probably sitting in a can for two months without a lid, faux-chicken breast (you know the kind that's made from 'pieces' and molded into what looks like a chicken breast) that tasted microwave fresh, and the iceberg greens that were lined with a pleasantly stale aroma.  Folks let this be a lesson: do not drive aimlessly while famished-- this is what happens.

I came to this TGIFriday with a few of my friends from my weightwatchers groups after one of our meeting.  We decided it would be nice to treat ourselves to a little indulgent food after all of out hard work at losing weight.  the food was pretty average and the service was good.   My main complaint was the lack of nutritional facts menus.  They keep only one on each table.  This made it a bit difficult for all 5 of use to take turns looking up what we wanted and how it would fit in with our diet.  It took use a totally of 30 minutes just to decided what we wanted because of the lack of these menus.  Also when we asked for more of them the waiter only gave us one more with helped a bit but in reality all 5 of use needed the nutritional facts menu.   I would probably visit this place again, but its not really anything special.

Boy did we regret coming here for dinner. We were seated promptly by a very nice hostess.  We sat for a while and our waitress came over to get drink orders. Waters all around.  My sister, the one who is having some "issues" right now, hasn't been eating very much. We figured that there would be plenty of different options on their menu that would entice her to eat something. There wasn't.  I ordered the Gourmet Mac N' Cheese, "Our rich and creamy five-cheese blend of Fontina, Bleu, Gruyere, white Cheddar and Parmesan is tossed with crispy bacon and penne pasta, and topped with Bleu cheese crumbles and a Parmesan-crust topping. Served with a juicy grilled chicken breast." (from website)  I didn't see the Bleu cheese part. Which I will admit is my fault. Who ever thought of this recipe, apparently from a Food TV Recipe Challenge, was high on Acid. It was D-Scuss-ting!  I refused to eat it. I even told the waitress who offered to have another order made without Bleu Cheese. I declined. It may not have had Bleu Cheese but probably would have had something else added that I shouldn't know about.  Their drink menu should be thrown outside and lit on fire. Almost every other mixed drink had that Blue Curacao stuff in it. I'm an adult who likes to drink. I don't drink blue drinks!  I ordered a Guinness. The best thing about my time here.  Never, no way. No thanks. I wont be back.

PARTY OF 7 We came here to take advantage of their appetizers. It was HAPPY HOUR.  The drinks and the appetizers were on a discount. We bought tons of dishes to eat. They were between the prices of $5, $6 and $7.   We tasted everything on the appetizer menu except the seafood dishes cause they were not on discount on Happy Hour. Haha.  It was just a lazy day before MONDAY.  We needed to slurge and have fun. Some of us had Margaritas and some of us had desserts at the end. Delicious Red Velvet Cake and the Strawberry Shortcake Vanilla Ice Cream.  Delicious.   Its a great place to just have a good time with friends for two hours and start the NEW WEEK again! I enjoyed!

Ehh... There's a reason this place is rated 2.5 stars. Went here specifically to get the Jack Daniel's burger, but the sauce tasted just like soy sauce with cinnamon. Service was okay, but we went during happy hour and of course they only had ~2 people manning the bar area. When we left, there were 4 girls standing toward the front by the hostess station.  We ordered a Mango something, and it was supposed to have alcohol in it, but I couldn't taste anything and didn't feel anything... I'm pretty sure they skipped that step. Service was a 3, I had to get up and ask for things. The waitress didn't know that my burger came with sweet potato fries, and I had to comment on it for her to look at the menu and then specially request it because apparently their system isn't equipped to allow sweet potato fries to go on the plate without charging me. Food was a 2, I could have made my chicken sandwich and done without the sauce. Atmosphere was blah - tables were sticky and one guy's chair even broke. I'd give it a 2.5, partly because that's what you'd expect, but I've been to better places.

went there mid-week for lunch as I was working on a project near by.  The food took FOREVER to come-out, and place wasn't busy at all. we ended up getting the food to go, since we didn't have the time to actually sit down and eat once the food came out.  Service was decent, but c'mon, there's nothing but business parks in that of town, so get it together folks.

This is only the second time that I have come to this Friday's and hopefully it will be the last.  The only reason that they get one star is because the waiting staff.  The food is absolutely terrible.  The lack of freshness is so apparent it's almost as if they are trying to serve people their new line of microwavable dinners. Quality of the food is extremely poor and not worth the money.

So very not good.  I know, it's hot today, so maybe that explains why it was incredibly uncomfortable there and multiple dining parties complained.  Drawing the shades helped, too bad a customer had to ask the manager to do it, and had to ask a few times, it seems.  They had to open the door to outside, that didn't help much.  We enjoyed our shaky tables seated directly across from the drink machine and messy staging area, after we walked through a nearly empty restaurant, which had much better air conditioning in the front part, to get to our fabulous table.  At least it made getting our drinks much easier, after the waitress disappeared.  We took bets on how many workers comp claims have been filed from waiters falling as they hop over the low wall separating the eating areas, as they are too lazy to walk around.  The food is standard over salted fatty chain restaurant food. Would I go back?  Hell no.

I remember college days where my friend and I would go to a packed tgi Fridays and enjoy the food. That time is long gone. I don't know what happened to tgi Fridays, but it saddens me to think it has sunk to this new low. There wasn't many people in the restraunt when I got there, so I'm thinking people have caught on to the poor choice of food and worse menu. Everyone in my party quickly noticed the calorie count on each menu item, so no one really wanted to order food... Good choice TGIF. The atmosphere was the same, just not very exciting. The service was great, so I can't give this place only 1 star. The table was clean, but the bench was covered in salt. I had to ask the hostess to wipe it down. The food was poor at best.  Not a place you'd want to pay for food, or take a person to on a date. The volume was quiet. The music playing was top 40 The restrooms are nice, well maintained and clean. Stocked with the necessities. Overall I give this place 2 stars. The food really killed the mood.

My fiance and I were looking for a late night meal and found exactly what we were looking for at TGI Friday's. It was late and we decided to sit at the bar but quickly moved when a fight broke out. We were moved to the other side of the restaurant and started to order. My fiance ordered the sliders and a hot green tea for starters.  We then ordered the Bruschetta Chicken Pasta and a Turkey Burger with salad.  Unfortunately, as the server approached our table with the sliders she dropped them on the floor. She was extremely apologetic and before she could put in another order for the sliders we cancelled it. I am glad that we did because when the rest of our meal came to the table and we began to eat our dinner it was just enough food.  I was completely satisfied with my meal and overall experience. I can't wait to try something new on their menu.  Hope to be back very soon!

This review is for lunch only. 10/27 = 3 stars I sat at the bar to wait for my friend.  I ordered drinks and they arrived shortly thereafter.  Then, I ordered Shrimp Cocktail for an appetizer and that took awhile.  When my friend showed up we ordered immediately as I was pressed for time.  It took over 30mins for our food to arrive. WTF?  The restaurant was pretty empty.   The only positive thing about this visit were their lunch specials.  I had my usual - Bruschetta Chicken Pasta.  This dish never disappoints.  In the past, this dish came w/bread but it doesn't anymore so I had to order a basket of garlic breadsticks.  The breadsticks had no flavor.  They were warm & fluffy but where was the garlic???  I was pleased that they offered Bruschetta Chicken Pasta in their lunch menu for a cheaper price and 1/2 the portion.  It was still plentiful so I had lunch it for lunch the next day.  11/3 = 2 stars My cousin hit me up to go to lunch before his trip for Guatemala.  I decided to give TGIF another try but this time I asked to be seated in their main dining room in hopes for better service. Our server was more attentive & very friendly but the wait time for our food did not change. In addition, I was unpleasantly surprised that they completely changed their lunch menu.  They no longer offer Bruschetta Chicken Pasta as a lunch special and their new lunch options did not look appetizing.  So screw it, I'll pay the full price for my usual.  When I find something I like I tend to stick to it. My food finally arrives but why did the meal also change???  This was always served with Angel Hair pasta.  Today it was served with Fettucini. Did they run out of Angel Hair or is this their new way of preparing it?  If it is, I'm never ordering it again.  Totally dissatisfied. Overall assessment - won't return for lunch but MAYBE keep it as an option for happy hour. Their HH drink specials are cheap & appetizers are tasty.  Just can't expect anymore than that.

TGIF's?  It ain't!!!  Everything ordered from them is so damn sweet!!!!  They better back them sauces up!!! Instead of eating apps and entrees, it seemed like I was eating dessert!!!  Yuck!!!! Ooh!  Man, the food, they need to work on that stuff, because if not...they will surely go out of business!!!  And certainly, they don't have my business.....I ain't comin' back!!!!

Pretty spooky area --even though we were in Pleasanton, this TGI is in a dead, dark shopping center. Came here tonight with a large party (20+) and ordered the Big Mex burger with 1/2 fries & 1/2 sweet potato fries ($9.59). The burger patty had no flavor and the cheese was tasteless. The only thing I liked about it was the corn/salsa/sour cream-ish thing that gave the burger some kind of flavor. The fries were terrible. They must have been sitting around for at least 20 or 30 minutes  -- the sweet potato fries were just okay. Service was pretty average, the server was friendly but the food took a long time to come out. On the plus side, everyone who ordered sodas and limeades got multiple refills. There was a small issue with settling the bill (we needed the $300 bill split among 5 or 6 different credit cards) but the waiter and his manager were very patient with us. Overall a pretty average dining experience -- 3 stars.

A surprising 4 stars for the food and then 2 stars for the ambiance. My husband and I become Facebook fans of TGI Friday's so that we could try the new Jack Daniel's burgers for free.  We used the coupons today which was the last day of the promotion.  The coupons didn't say anything like "one per party" so we were good to go. We arrived extremely early for lunch because we were both starving.  I was immediately hit by the stench of dirty dish rags.  I seriously stopped breathing through my nose after that.   Also, the decor is just so tired.  I really don't want to sit across from a sanitary napkin dispenser circa 1970. Now onto the food: I can't believe I'm going to say this but these were the best fries I've had in a long time.  So crispy and on the thin side and great tasting.  I didn't need any ketchup at all.  Maybe it's key to always get the first fries of the day so that the oil is fresh? I ended up ordering the Jack Daniel's Chicken Sandwich and my husband got the Jack Daniel's Burger.  Lots of bacon and cheese and great flavors.  Once again, I was shocked. Since our bill was for sodas only, I left a nice tip because I have a feeling the waitress wasn't expecting anything from this coupon-wielding couple.

Hi World,  Isn't TGIFriday's the same everywhere? Cocktail specials, giant mai tais and other fruity drinks with umbrellas, vegetarian hell with a menu composed mainly of steak, steak, burgers, ribs and more burgers, and deep fried potato skins, or something. It's a tacky eatery but it's fine for that. It's an ironic thing, like hipster mustaches.   The staff was fine and they wore adequate flair. The food is nothing special but I always know what I'm in for. If you're expecting something spectacular, don't fucking go to TGIFriday's!

I use to frequent this place, but had been a while since I came to this location and or any location for that matter. The only reason I was dragged in was because those new commercials just made the food look D-Lish, I couldn't help the temptation. Of course they didn't have what I saw on the commercial, so I stuck to my usual Jack Daniels Chicken. The chicken breast were so small, and for 13.99 I was very disappointed.  The service was decent for a sunday night at 9pm. The peanut butter Pie was EXCELLENT. And I probably won't return anytime soon. Will continue to go to Red Robin's or Applebee's (which are closer to my home)

It's so true about the gnat issues.  I've eaten here a few times, and "yes" I DO recall shooing away little gnats, wtf!!!  I don't have any complaints about service the way other reviewers do, but like my review of the Elephant Bar - I'll choose another TGIF location versus this one.  The food is always good here, just don't waste your money on the sliders.  Coming here for happy hours is also good.  Trying all their salty appetizers for less is the way to go.  Although with a gnat issue, I'm not sure if I'll be back anytime soon; I mean it makes you wonder what else is lingering around the kitchen.

The only reason I come to TGI friday's is because of their delicious Jack Daniels sauce. The food itself isn't very good and a burger for 10 dollars is outrageous but that sauce is so addicting it keeps bringing me back.  After going a few months without my "precious" sauce, I was visiting in dublin and decided to relapse in my addiction. My girlfriend and I happened to make it just in time for happy hour and ordered a mango smoothie drink with rum. We could not taste the rum at all. I'm 99% sure they didn't put any but the drink itself was delicious. It was huge too! I can't imagine drinking one of those on my own. I ordered my usual Jack Daniels burger and my GF ordered the chicken  burger. My Jack Daniels sauce at this location didn't seem to taste as good as the one in South San Francisco. It was still good but not quite the same. My GF's sauce was terrible. I don't remember what it was called but it tasted too cinnamony.  The service was really good. Our waitress was really nice and kept coming back to ask us if we needed anything. Another waiter also kept making sure our meal was good.  Overall, service is 5 stars, food is 2 stars, happy hour 3 stars (not much of a discount and not enough alcohol in the drink).
Over cooked veggies and bland food. Starters were okay. Bruschetta tastes like quick $1 noodles. Not coming again.

I came here a few months back and wanted to write a review and forgot.   I wanted to go somewhere and watch the NBA finals and have a beer. The Tv's in this bar are about 20 years old. They are so small you could never distinguish what the score was. It is not a good place to go and watch a game.

Went to Fridays on 4/8/2009 with my friend. Happy hour is great since everything is half off. The food was fine, nothing to special. If I could make a request, would it be possible to throw a salad or two on the happy hour menu or maybe a veggie tray? I feel so guilty eating all that deep fried food. It's really the only thing on the menu besides the hot wings and quesadillas.   Anyhow, overall not a bad place.

I'm almost never in the Pleasanton area, but I happened to be this weekend. My friends and I were going to try to grab a bite to eat on Main St., but were thwarted by some kind of parade that was happening that day. Aside from Main St., you're pretty much limited to chain restaurants in Pleasanton and we were pretty hungry after driving around parade traffic and settled on the TGI Fridays. Now I have pretty low standards for TGI Fridays, but this place couldn't even meet them. The fork I received wrapped in a napkin with a knife was dirty, as was the one my friend got. The waitress seemed miffed when we asked for clean ones. She returned with another fork and knife (also wrapped in a napkin). This fork was not clean either, but was usable after rinsing it with some water from my water glass. We got to sit outside which was nice, even if the patio overlooks the strip mall parking lot and the wind blows around much of the Friday's flair on the table. I ordered a Cesear salad with shrimp. There was a decent amount of grilled shrimp on the salad, but most of the lettuce was wilted and looked like it'd been around awhile. Definitely one of the more disgusting meals I've had in awhile.
i love fridays, i only give one star less because they dont have the awsome blossom anymore, which i would go there just for it. lovve their food and happy hour

Fridays is to restaurants as Family Circus is to comic strips.  It had its day, and now they just mail it in until people finally realize it sucks.  This particular location is especially strong with the smell of death.  Think "SweetRiver Saloon". From the filthy ceiling tiles to the singular smell of too many uncleaned ketchup spills in the carpeting...this place smells like granny in her mid nineties.  The food all tasted like they pulled it from the TGI Fridays frozen section at Safeway and reheated it.  Suprise! Someday, this poor old lady will be gone. Until then, you can still go in and see a restaurant on oxygen and an artificial heart, while the smell of restaurant death hangs menacingly in the air.

We went to take advantage of the buy one get one entree coupon. It just so happened that it was happy hour all day so all appetizers were half off. So we got a pretty good deal for the food. Food was okay...nothing extraordinary but reliable. We knew we were going for the deals and decent food. Not too crowded and service was pretty good for lunch time. Would probably come again if I had a coupon or for happy hour.

I had only been to the one in Union Landing in Union City before so I guess I had the same vibe in mind.  This location was a lot more CALM...the lighting was kind of dark and there was no action at all.  And this was on a weekend night.  The food was alrite...(I got a sizzling chicken and shrimp platter) but the shrimp tasted extra fishy and was almost hard for me to tolerate eating.  The drinks are hella pricy here too for a very low alcohol content.  I think Id prefer to just stick to the one in Union City from now on...the drinks are stronger there and its more of a LIVELY vibe.  One plus was that there was NO WAIT here...in union City you will wait a long time on the weekend.

For some reason they have 4 bartenders behind the bar and it still takes 5 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge that you are sitting there. You ask tortillas and it takes 10 minutes to get them. I think that someone hopped on to a red eye and went to Mexico to get them. The "mango" mai tae is not mango. It tasted like shit but it did the job. I asked for something with a strawberry flavor and I got what I thought was pink lemonade. I got drunk off of two drinks so I can't complain. The sizzling chicken and shrimp was damn good. This was one of my better experiences that I had at Fridays. Word of advice.... only go to the one in Union City if you want to be shot by some gangsters! Ohhhh or if you like police walking around in the restaurant. Make you feel REAL safe huh!

Ok so I continue to frequent this place regularly. Among the casual dining restaurant chains, this is among my favorite. Their new stripes card is great; it gets you discounts and coupons for free appetizers. The service has improved and been consistently good, not exceptional but good. Food is always consistent and I love many items on their menu. Sunday is happy hour all day with cheap beer and cocktails, $1.50 sliders and fries and all appetizers are half off. With football on the screens and affordable drinks it has been great all season - also much less crowded than other places so I don't have to worry about trying to get service or seating once a game has started.

Went here on "SUPERBOWL SUNDAY" with my Fiance & room mate and had an excellent time there, food was great. Had one of there burgers (Jack Daniels) and it was pretty good; a bit salty ,but it was alright.  also tried there "Crispy green bean fries" and they are delicious w/ some wasabi sauce, if you never tried these before, you should.  Then had there fried macaroni (which taste way better than Cheesecake factory).  The service there was excellent , very friendly workers and good atmosphere.  I would definitely come back again.

Service SUCKS!! Good Food. I was shocked when my server B****told me that i can't have a drink at my table....I have go to the bar even though i was having dinner there....Plz don't take ur loved ones there. U will be embaresed

i normally like TGI Fridays.  so i was excited when i found out there was one in pleasanton.  the food of course is that same as all the others but the service was just crappy.  our waitress just dissappeared for about 30 minutes.  later we found out her shift ended and some fat guy was supposed to be our waiter.  this guy never came over untill about i complained to the manager that we hadnt seen a waiter in over half an hour.  once the guy came he acted like he was mad at me.  imagine that.  so we just walked out i dont like working with pissed off waiters cause i know what they do with your food.  so for sure i wont be back to this tgi ill have to try a different one.

This Fridays has been around somewhere in the fifteen year range and the inside is really starting to show signs of needing a face lift.  The mens bathroom is a little gross looking and smelling with the grout between the tiles on the wall being in need of either serious scrubbing or replacement as I'm pretty sure it wasn't that color originally.  The urinal on the right had no intact caulking and was visibly detached from the wall though it did work fine. So why three stars?  Because the food was very well prepared.  Our fried shrimp was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside and the Salmon was tender and tasty.  The fries were also very good. In addition to the bathrooms I have to say that the whole "old stuff on the walls" look is really past its prime.  Especially given the dim lighting. Our waiter was prompt, courteous and got our order 100% correct which was also good. We've been here many times during the time this location has been open and while we don't get there as often these days as we used to the experience is still solid.  Given the quality of the food and wait staff I'd easily give this location four stars if it they did a moderate remodel to spruce things up.

Why must coworkers of all walks of life must go to places like this for lunch/dinners?  Seriously, its like every time there is a "group luncheon" or "dinner" people have to open their traps and mention places like this... So let me get this straight, You want me to pay $50.00 for a half eaten dried out hamburger, one large sprite, and some soggy fries? Last time I check that only totaled me $15 with TIP and and Taxes you cheap bastards...  What? You want me to pay that because you decided to get the fancy punches and refill them 4 - 5 times while ordering the steak meal wuth all the fix'n? Shoot your meal alone is like $45... Oh The Food? it's about as good as their "frozen appetizers" you can buy at just about every grocery store. I had some "wings" which consisted of something I remembered back in grade school. Remember them nasty "mystery" chicken things? Yeah talk about a flash back from 3rd grade rocking Kangaroos and barfing up them dollar lunches.. NO MAS! And if you are reading this you probably know  or have been pulled into places like this from a coworker... Maybe next time some of you (cheap bastard coworkers) will choke on them poppers... THE END
Your average TGIF. Frequently come here for happy hour after work. Friendly staf & good crowd.  Appetizers are good. Steak & lobster are good and not bad priced.
Food wasnt even put in so our order was never placed. We ended up still having to pay while everyone around ate and were leaving well before our kids got their food... Never again!

The food was ok, just like any other TGIF. Me and my brother got food poisoned pretty bad after coming here. That or the sweet tarts we both had. I'm not eating sweet tarts any more either. This was probably an year ago.

the only good thing about TGI Fridays is going there on sunday when most the appetizers are 50% off. I mean the service there is good and friendly but for some reason no matter what you order. whether its a small or large amount of food, it always takes a long time to get food. Im usually a little buzz before i get my food, then im always taking to go...

If you don't know my history with Friday's (don't call it T.G.I. -- it's just Friday's damnit), then you won't understand why I'm giving this place five stars.  It's ridiculous, I know.  I KNOW. Service is OK ... food is OK ... all very average.  This place does average like nobody's business.  I do enjoy the Junebug drink, though, which is no longer on the menu, but you can still get it.  Yes, ordering "off the menu" at Friday's.  I am THAT cool. But aside from the mediocrity of food and service, this Friday's in particular brings me fond memories.  When I was in high school, my friends and I had this one crazy waiter practically every time we came here named Jeremy who would always wear a Riddler hat (a la Batman -- this was back when the red and white striped shirts and "flair" were still the thing).  My friend Leann got her hair tied with helium balloons for her 16th birthday.  My boyfriend and I went on our first "date" here (it wasn't really an official date, and we were 18).  I've celebrated various friends' birthdays here and other special-yet-casual occasions.  I try to visit this place still at least once a year or so just for old time's sake.  Ah, the memories.

LAME! and that's putting it lightly. If I could give them 11/2 stars I would, but I gave them the benefit of the doubt. I came here with my family on a, I believe it was a Friday afternoon for lunch. I actually made the suggestion to come here because I had always gone to the Union City location and had yummy and satisfying meals and the service was on point. I thought it might be the same. Boy was I wrong. First off, it's in a  deserted area surrounded by other businesses that seemed to be closed or have been closed for a while. Upon walking in  the lights were very dim and it felt kind of gloomy. We got seated right away, probably being that we were the one of probably 5 families that were there that afternoon. Anyway, our waitress seemed like she was in a rush to seat us and take our order. Then waiting for our meals took FOREVER. And I'm not over exaggerating, my dad and I were able to marvel at almost all of the knick-knacks on the wall. I think I remember it being almost 45 minutes for our food to come out. I mean how long could it take when there were no more than a few other families and others there? The waitress did not apologize for the wait, neither did she come to ask how everything was and if we needed anything during our meal. The food was mediocre, and it did not satisfy, which made for a bunch of grumpy people since we were already starving from waiting for so long. I am definitely not coming back here anytime soon, if ever. I'd rather go the extra mile and go the the Friday's in Union City. At least there I can enjoy my surroundings because the ambiance is a lot more friendly and it won't take years to get my food.

This place was okay. The wait was about 10-15 minutes, yet they had plenty of empty tables? What the... Anyway when we saw that, we just sat ourselves near the bar since it was seat yourself seating anyway. The waiter was friendly, but a little unobservant and slow with checking up on us.  We didn't have silverware by the time our food came, so I got it at the bar after waiting around 10 minutes or so. The waiter only came around 3 times: to come get our order, to drop off the check and to check up on the food like literally 3 minutes after the food came (a food runner brought  us our food).  So all in all, the service sucked, but was friendly when we got it. The food was another story. Our food came hot and smelled delicious. The chicken portion was a little small compared to what I was used to seeing. Both chicken breasts from the jack daniel's chicken was smaller than the size of 1 of my hands. It was tasty though. I normally don't like mashed potatoes, but theirs was something to rave about. It had a cheesy and garlic flavor. Yummy!  All in all it was pretty average because of the service. If I'm near this location again, I'll probably do carry out unless I want to drink to the happy hour specials.

I've eaten here a few times over the past decade, having grown up in the East Bay...most recently was a goodbye dinner for a friend moving to Ohio, so I guess the dim lighting was appropriate. I don't ever go in to a TGIFridays expecting an amazing experience, and that's fine.  The food was good, and I had an excellent waitress who saw to it that I got the right beer (they were out of my first choice). I think the best thing was our waitress made jokes about spanking her coworker.  Spanking humor = bigger tip from me.  ;)

Your typical TGIF. Friendly staff, fast service. Nice parking lot out front in the Rose Pavilion. Potato skins are still killer appetizers.  The rest of food is mediocre, on par with Chili's.  It's good, but nothing to write home about.    A solid three stars.

I've given this place a shot on numerous occasions and there hasn't been one time where I've been thrilled w/ my experience. I'm a pretty easy person to please, especially when it comes to eating out....Service is most of the reason I'm so disappointed. Seems that the 3 servers I can remember on three different occasions are the reason my experience is negative.

I'm really surprised by all the negative reviews, but then of course it seems that most people will take time to write negative reviews versus positive ones.   In all honesty I don't usually come here to have dinner in the main dining room.  It's usually in the bar area for appetizers and /or dinner.  I'm not a drinker, but they have one of the best happy hours in town from 3 to 7 and then from 10 till closing.  It's hard to find a place that's open in Pleasanton past 10 let alone a happy hour.   The food to me is fine based on what you're paying for it.  As I said happy hour all appetizers are half price and you can always find a "two for one" entree coupon if you're on their e-mail or mailing list .   I've never had a bad experience with their food in regards to getting sick and for the money it's better than a lot of other fancier places. However, what I like best about the Pleasanton Friday's are the employees and customers.  If you go to the bar area it's almost like CHeers.  There are the regulars (of which I am one) and the bartenders are all nice and even more so when you get to now them.  QUite frankly sometimes I'm not even hungry, but it's a place to go and socialize. I had to laugh about people complaining about the parking lot.  It's a parking lot for christ's sake, just deal with it! And yes the decor is outdated, but I'll take that over the bright lights and expense of a newer restaurant. Love Friday's in P-Town!
This place gets worse and worse every time I go in. You never know if your food will be hot or cold or if  will order will be right.
Slowest service on the planet.  20 minutes to get the salad and another 20 for the entree.  Never again!

Last time I will come here.  It was not busy but we kept having to wait.  One of the people in our party was given dirty silverware too.  I also think it is pretty overpriced compared to similar spots like Applebees or Chilis - we paid 40 bucks for 2 meals & 2 sodas...

Let's be honest - I don't come here for the food, but I love the drinks! Jayda has been my bartender almost all of my drinking life :) so I am definitely taken care of, but woo-hoo for the ladies nights!!!! Thanks to June, I bought a new Brighton purse that I got 3 compliments on before I paid for it, and Martini Night sent me home with 4 glasses that I got to paint myself for $3 each (actually, I only bought 2 and won the other 2 in raffle). For a laid back, low-key Saturday night, this is where you will find me.

My bf and I come here on sundays cause thats the only time im in the area, they have Happy Hour in the bar and dining area all day on sundays  :) so we come here to get 1/2 off apps and 5 dollar drinks. The service is good and prices are great :)

This TGIF used to be good but has been heading downhill for the last year or so. Jack Daniel steaks are overcooked. Some of the waitresses are totally unprofessional. At 7PM this evening there weren't many people when normally it would be fairly busy. Probably a sign of how bad it has gotten. I wouldn't be surprised if this location closed by the end of the year. Eat elsewhere.

Met up with some friends around 7.30 for drinks and dinner.  Was there until closing @ midnight.  Sat out on the patio the whole night enjoying the hot weather.  Waitstaff was super nice, but drinks were taking a bit long to get to our table.  Even ordering a beer would take about 5 minutes.  But other than that, the people that worked there was super friendly, and not once did they make us feel like we needed to leave b/c they were closing! We ordered several items from the menu.  Jack Daniels Chicken Appetizer, Buffalo Wings, Buffalo Chicken Boneless Wings, and Shrimp Cocktail.  The JD Chicken is very similar to the Boneless Buffalo...just different sauce.  A bit too much batter for my taste!  I liked the wings a lot better.  The shrimp cocktail was average at best.  The shrimp did not taste really that fresh, but fresh enough where it wasn't hazardous to your health to eat.   Oh yeah, if you're trying to read the menu on the patio at night, good luck to you!  Very, very little lighting so doing any kind of work out there is impossible, unless you have a flashlight. I'd go back.....but only b/c it's 3 minutes from my house.
